verses.verse: And Abram<WH87> went up<WH5927> out of Egypt<WH4714>, he<WH802>, and his wife, and all that he had<WH3876>, and Lot with him<WH5045>, into the south.
And Abram<WH87> was very<WH3966> rich<WH3513> in cattle<WH4735>, in silver<WH3701>, and in gold<WH2091>.

And he went<WH3212> on his journeys<WH4550> from the south<WH5045> even to Beth<WH1008>–el, unto the place<WH4725> where his tent<WH168> had been<WH1961> at the beginning<WH8462>, between Beth<WH1008>–el and Hai<WH5857>;
Unto the place<WH4725> of the altar<WH4196>, which he had made<WH6213> there at the first<WH7223>: and there Abram<WH87> called<WH7121> on the name<WH8034> of the Lord<WH3068>.
And Lot<WH3876> also<WH1980>, which went with<WH854> Abram<WH87>, had flocks<WH6629>, and herds<WH1241>, and tents<WH168>.

And the land<WH776> was not able to carry<WH5375> them<WH3427>, that they might live together<WH3162>: for their substance<WH7399> was great<WH7227>, so that they could<WH3201> not live<WH3427> together<WH3162>.

And there was strife<WH7379> between the herdsmen<WH7462> of Abram<WH87>'s cattle<WH4735> and the herdsmen<WH7462> of Lot<WH3876>'s cattle<WH4735>: and the Canaanite<WH3669> and the Perizzite<WH6522> lived<WH3427> then in the land<WH776>.

And Abram<WH87> said<WH559> unto Lot<WH3876>, Let there be<WH1961> no<WH408> strife<WH4808>, I pray you<WH7462>, between me and you, and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen<WH7462>; for we<WH582> are brothers<WH251>.

Is not the whole land<WH776> before you<WH6440>? Separate yourself<WH6504>, I ask you<WH8040>, from me: if you will take the left hand, then I will go to the right<WH3231>; or if you depart to the right hand<WH3225>, then I will go to the left<WH8041>.

And Lot<WH3876> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and saw<WH7200> all the plain<WH3603> of Jordan<WH3383>, that it was well watered<WH4945> every where<WH6440>, before the Lord<WH3068> destroyed<WH7843> Sodom<WH5467> and Gomorrah<WH6017>, even as the garden<WH1588> of the Lord<WH3068>, like the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, as you come<WH935> unto Zoar<WH6820>.
Then Lot<WH3876> chose<WH977> him all the plain<WH3603> of Jordan<WH3383>; and Lot<WH3876> journeyed<WH5265> east<WH6924>: and they separated themselves<WH6504> the one<WH376> from the other<WH251>.
Abram<WH87> lived<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, and Lot<WH3876> lived<WH3427> in the cities<WH5892> of the plain<WH3603>, and pitched his tent<WH167> toward<WH5704> Sodom<WH5467>.
But the men<WH582> of Sodom<WH5467> were wicked<WH7451> and sinners<WH2400> before the Lord<WH3068> exceedingly<WH3966>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Abram<WH87>, after<WH310> that Lot<WH3876> was separated<WH6504> from him<WH5375>, Lift up now your eyes<WH5869>, and look<WH7200> from the place<WH4725> where you are northward<WH6828>, and southward<WH5045>, and eastward<WH6924>, and westward<WH3220>:
For all the land<WH776> which you see<WH7200>, to you will I give it<WH5414>, and to your seed<WH2233> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.

And I will make<WH7760> your seed<WH2233> as the dust<WH6083> of the earth<WH776>: so that<WH834> if a man<WH376> can<WH3201> number<WH4487> the dust<WH6083> of the earth<WH776>, then shall your seed<WH2233> also be numbered<WH4487>.
Arise<WH6965>, walk<WH1980> through the land<WH776> in the length<WH753> of it and in the breadth<WH7341> of it<WH5414>; for I will give it unto you.

Then Abram<WH87> removed his tent<WH167>, and came<WH935> and lived<WH3427> in the plain<WH436> of Mamre<WH4471>, which is in Hebron<WH2275>, and built<WH1129> there a altar<WH4196> unto the Lord<WH3068>.
